t: Genesis 10
Nations Descended from Noah
Now*p this is*i the genealogy of the sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth. And sons were born to them after the flood.
The*p sons of Japheth were*i Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
The sons of Gomer were*i Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
The sons of Javan were*i Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
From these the coastland peoples*i of the Gentiles were separated into their lands, everyone according to his language, according to their families, into their nations.
The*p sons of Ham were*i Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
The sons of Cush were*i Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabtechah; and the sons of Raamah were*i Sheba and Dedan.
Cush*p begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
He was a mighty hunter before the Lord;*s therefore it is said, “Like Nimrod the mighty hunter before the Lord.”*s
And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
From that land he went to Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,
and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (that is*i the principal city).
Mizraim*p begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and Caphtorim).
Canaan*p begot Sidon his firstborn, and Heth;
the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite;
the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite;
the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were dispersed.
And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon as you go toward Gerar, as far as Gaza; then as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.
These were*i the sons of Ham, according to their families, according to their languages, in their lands and*i in their nations.
And*p children*i were born also to Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder.
The sons of Shem were*i Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
The sons of Aram were*i Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
Arphaxad begot Salah, and Salah begot Eber.
To Eber were born two sons: the name of one was*i Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was*i Joktan.
Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were*i the sons of Joktan.
And their dwelling place was from Mesha as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.
These were*i the sons of Shem, according to their families, according to their languages, in their lands, according to their nations.
These*p were*i the families of the sons of Noah, according to their generations, in their nations; and from these the nations were divided on the earth after the flood.
